= Introduction =
==Required Components==

*libpam-devel* (>= 0.99.8)

*OpenCV 1.00*
Get it from http://sourceforge.net/projects/opencvlibrary/


Installation Instructions

http://opencvlibrary.sourceforge.net/InstallGuide_Linux


After Installation of OpenCV

||PKG_CONFIG_PATH=/where/you/have/installed/opencv/lib/pkgconfig:${PKG_CONFIG_PATH} ||
||export PKG_CONFIG_PATH||


*GSL 1.9*
Get it from http://www.gnu.org/software/gsl/

Once you have the components needed

===Extract pam-face-authentication Package===


Following Commands should be executed as root
{{{
./configure
make
}}}
*run as super user*
{{{
make install
}}}

==How to Configure Face with a Username?==
{{{
gtk-facemanager
}}}

if you get this error : *
"error while loading shared libraries: libcxcore.so.1: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory" *
{{{ 
ln -s /opencvinstallpath/opencv-1.0.0/lib/* /usr/lib/

}}}

===Testing if it works===
{{{ vi /etc/pam.d/su }}}

*Add Line at the top*
{{{`auth    sufficient     pam_face_authenticate.so` }}}

{{{ su UserName }}}

if everything is all right , you should be able to see the following screen

http://pam-face-authentication.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/images/Screenshot-3.png

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
===Adding PAM module for gdm===
{{{ vi /etc/pam.d/gdm }}}

*Add Line at the top*
{{{ auth    sufficient     pam_face_authenticate.so }}}


|| CAUTION : Never should 'required' be written instead of sufficient ||
